body_content.explanation: the process of combining two companies into one bigger company, or of a larger company buying a smaller company :
examples: She worked on mergers and acquisitions, specializing in asset valuation.
The law prohibits mergers and acquisitions where the resulting company would hold a monopoly over the industry.
One of the top mergers and acquisitions lawyers in the country thought the brokered deal would only weaken the new company.
The mergers and acquisitions team recommended selling the properties of the acquired company to improve liquidity.
